content.description: Start as Quivering Beast, but instead of moving up at the first set jugs on the face, keep climbing the overhang further left. Move to a sloping ledge around the corner, then into a difficult section of incredible climbing involving pockets, arete slapping and technical heel hooking.  Super classic for the area.
content.location: Start as Quivering Beast, traverses under roof and tops out above the cave, just left of an arete.

content.description:
Roof jugs. The climbing equivalent of a three ring circus. 

  Sit start at the far right side at jugs. Climb left through a long series of roof moves using pockets and cobbles to a grouping of enormous jugs on the upper face. Finish on another ten feet of good holds.
content.location: Roof of the big boulder, longest line from way back right to uphill end.

content.description: Thuggy climbing out of a steep overhang. Nautilus climbs a series of pockets on the left side of the Beast roof. SDS from a right hand undercling and left hand crimp then toss to a distant left hand. Long moves between good holds lead to the lip.

Long moves through good holds lead to a crimp and a big move. 

  From the starting holds of the Beast problems move straight up the face using pockets and jugs. A long reach is encountered near the top.
content.location: West face of the Beast, at the jugs on the lowest point of the big roof.

content.description: Start as for Beast/Mily Wimpshae on low jugs on right side of wall. Move up to first slopey ledge, then begin traversing left and slightly up on sloping rail. Traverse all the way to two large pockets, then topout.
content.location: Right side of west face of Beast Boulder, then moves way left and up.

content.description: Big low overhang is the most obvious feature of this boulder. West side has a gentle overhang with the left side forming a large roof. The belly is a mix of bowling balls and pockets.
